intro: Polygala pedemontana subsp. forojulensis, commonly known as the Forojulens Polygala, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Europe. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spicate inflorescences and small, often colorful flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the species. It typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climate conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in its native habitat.
